newsitem.title: GERMANY: Waigel turns up late to Telekom party.
newsitem.headline: Waigel turns up late to Telekom party.

text.p: German Finance Minister Theo Waigel turned up late to the biggest investor party of the year on Monday, missing the opening news conference which kicked off the high-profile listing of Deutsche Telekom stock.
"Frankfurt traffic was not a problem," Waigel said, as he arrived at the stock exchange here around 10 minutes after the news conference ended. "It was fog in south Germany which made me late."

The minister's speech to the news conference -- called to celebrate Europe's largest-ever flotation and broadcast live on German television -- had to be read out by Finance Ministry State Secretary Juergen Stark, who is Waigel's top aide.
Asked later whether he had joined millions of ordinary German citizens in snapping up stock in the state-owned firm, Waigel said he had reluctantly let the issue pass him by.
"As an insider I couldn't buy Telekom shares. But if I wasn't finance minister I definitely would have bought them," he said.
